Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory965.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "Next, we'll be reliving those missions in the sim, Commandant.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'The target for this sim battle is a spray-type infected unit called "Graffiti Artist."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Even if we've beaten them before, we can't afford to let our guard down.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Commandant, is there anything else you'd like to go over before we begin?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Why revisit the old battle logs?', 3: '2009', 4: 'What kind of enemy is this "Graffiti Artist"?', 5: '2011', 6: 'Understood. No further questions.', 7: '2013'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Simulation Review builds a holographic battlefield using the combat data we've collected.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "The holographic space can recreate mission scenarios down to the smallest detail. It's a great way to sharpen combat skills.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "The briefing says he's a machine infected by the Punishing Virus.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Hunting down Corrupted on the surface is one of Gray Raven's key missions.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Alright, time to head out.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Lucia steps to your side and opens the combat room door first.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "Let's team up again today, Commandant.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Graffiti Art', 2: 'Chapter 1', 3: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Atlas/CommonLogo/BgLogo1.png'}
{1: 'ThemeEnable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory49.jpg'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "How can it be all right?! You're hurt all over, and now you can't feel because you cut off your pain receptors.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Stay put! I'll try to temporarily reinforce your damaged parts...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "I'm sorry, Lucia.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "I wasn't of much help that last fight.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Her... speed... her precision... It's a miracle I survived that long...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'It was pure guesswork that I managed to deflect those few blows...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'I see... From what I can surmise from that battle, her blade strategy set shares great similarities to yours.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Similar...? Beaten at my own game, then... If only my visual signals weren't...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "I don't understand... Why was I... the only one affected?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: '...Something like that has never happened before.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'The Memory Inductive Neural Depository, or M.I.N.D. system of us Constructs function in a vastly different way than the logic circuits of mechs and androids—', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Which means it is extremely difficult to disrupt a specific target.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'So unless they have a far more superior grasp of M.I.N.D. tech than the scientists back at Babylonia, it is impossible to specifically target someone.', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: '...At least the battle data was recorded, now we only have to wait for the analytics from HQ.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Let's hurry to the nearest meeting point.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: '30 seconds, Miss Wounded Lucia. There are still 30 seconds before your nano-reinforcement glue stabilizes. Wait.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Understood...', 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory11.jpg'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'This is the designated meeting point.', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "But there's a ton of... Construct.. remains... and Corrupted roaming around here...?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "We're too late, the battle here's already over.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Look at the signal emitter over there—', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 3: 'A broken Corrupted lay motionless on the radio. Although it had lost its power, it had managed to insert its arm into the radio and completely corrupt it.', 4: '4'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: '...The Constructs here lost hold. From the traces of battle here, they must have already given it their best...', 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryHitNew.prefab', 3: '1'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryHitNew.prefab', 4: '1'}
{3: "Lucia steps forward and ends the Corrupted's life with one swift cut. She then destroys the corrupted emitter in several slashes.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'So these signals are all just... bait from the Corrupted...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Looks like you're right. It's a primitive trap, but we fell right in it since we need supplies so badly... Should we keep going, Commandant?", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Search more thoroughly for friendly signals.', 3: '76', 4: 'Immediately leave to avoid being besieged.', 5: '83'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "The longer we dawdle in this trap, the greater the danger we face, but... I'll still support your decision.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Liv, you have better searching capabilities, so we'll leave that to you.", 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Commandant! W-wait!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: '...Wait! Several distress signals are blinking weakly nearby!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'They must have been in hiding before and are now trying to ask for our help.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "But the battle has already been going on for a long time. They haven't recalled yet?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Recall?', 3: '95', 4: 'They must have something important to convey.', 5: '105'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'This should be basic knowledge for squads and commandants...', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "A Construct's memory is unique just like a human's. However, Constructs can initiate a long-range recall just before their frame is destroyed.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Though this would heavily deviate their M.I.N.D. thought model from the standard humanity thought model, it is still preferable to complete annihilation.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'If their M.I.N.D. is destroyed before they recall, then their memory will be completely destroyed.', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Quite possible, especially since that enemy is capable of destroying their entire Construct squad.', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Oh, no! Corrupted picked up their signal! A horde of Corrupted are headed right toward them!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Commandant, your orders!', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Gray Raven, prepare for battle!', 3: '116'}
